title: Slow Cooker Texas Pulled Pork Recipe (with Video)
description: This pulled pork recipe braises pork shoulder in a tangy barbeque sauce in the slow cooker until fall-apart tender. Delicious served in toasted buns.

Texas Pulled Pork 4.6 (3,221) 2,409 Reviews 244 Photos This Texas-style pulled pork recipe has a tangy barbeque sauce that's easy to make in the slow cooker. I like to serve the shredded pork on toasted buttered rolls. My family's favorite! Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 244 244 244 244 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 5 hrs Total Time: 5 hrs 15 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 sandwiches Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This pulled pork recipe is tender, juicy, and oh-so flavorful ‚Äî and it‚Äôs incredibly easy to make in your slow cooker! How to Make Pulled Pork Making barbecue-restaurant-worthy pulled pork is easier to make than you think. You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Pulled Pork Ingredients Oil: This pulled pork recipe starts with a teaspoon of vegetable oil at the bottom of your slow cooker.¬†Pork: If your pork shoulder roast is larger or smaller than four pounds, you‚Äôll need to adjust the ingredient rations and cook time.¬†¬†Sauces: You‚Äôll need bottled barbecue sauce, yellow mustard, and Worcestershire sauce.Apple cider vinegar: Apple cider vinegar adds brightness and cuts through the other rich flavors.¬†Broth: Use store-bought or homemade chicken broth.¬†Brown sugar: Light brown sugar lends warmth and sweetness.¬†Seasonings: This flavorful pork is seasoned with chili powder, garlic, and dried thyme.¬†Onion: A chopped onion gives the pork tons of flavor.¬†Buns and butter: You‚Äôll need buttered hamburger buns if you plan to make pulled pork sandwiches.¬† Which Cut of Meat for Pulled Pork? This recipe calls for a pork shoulder roast for a few reasons: It‚Äôs inexpensive, forgiving to work with, and tends to have a lot of marbling (which means it‚Äôll result in tender pulled pork).¬† How to Make Pulled Pork In the Slow Cooker Here‚Äôs a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade pulled pork in the slow cooker: Pour oil into the slow cooker, then place the roast on top of the oil.¬†Add the remaining ingredients to the slow cooker.¬†Cover and cook until the pork shreds easily.¬†Shred the pork and return it to the slow cooker to combine it with the juices.¬†If you‚Äôre making sandwiches, serve the pulled pork on buttered buns.¬† How Much Pulled Pork Per Person? You‚Äôll need about 1‚ÅÑ3- to ¬Ω-pound pork per person. This recipe, which starts with a 4-pound pork roast, serves about eight people.¬† What to Serve With Pulled Pork Wondering what to serve with your pulled pork? Explore this collection of Our Best Barbecue Side Dishes. Here are a few of the recipes you‚Äôll find:¬† Baked Beans from Scratch Simple Macaroni and Cheese Traditional Creamy Coleslaw What to Do With Leftover Pulled Pork Never let your leftovers go to waste! Check out our collection of Leftover Pulled Pork Recipes for delicious inspiration. Here are some of the mouthwatering recipes you can expect:¬† Creamy Pulled Pork Soup Quick and Easy Pulled Pork Burritos Pulled Pork Nachos with Sriracha Slaw How to Store Pulled Pork Store the (completely cooled) pulled pork in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. You can freeze pulled pork for up to six months.¬† How to Reheat Pulled Pork To ensure the pulled pork doesn‚Äôt dry out, we recommend reheating it in the oven or in the slow cooker instead of the microwave. Make sure to save the juices so you can reheat them with the pork.¬† Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise ‚ÄúExcellent recipe,‚Äù according to kkingsley2. ‚ÄúVery delicious. I added some pepperoncini peppers and a few splashes of Frank's red hot sauce.‚Äù ‚ÄúOh my gosh!! The best I‚Äôve ever had,‚Äù raves Jlynn. ‚ÄúEven my pickiest eater ate her whole sandwich and wanted more.‚Äù ‚ÄúI've made this recipe multiple times, every time it's amazing,‚Äù says one Allrecipes community member. ‚ÄúThe only thing I suggest doing is putting in the meat last. So you can properly mix up the ingredients.‚Äù Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 teaspoon vegetable oil 1 (4 pound) pork shoulder roast 1 cup barbeque sauce ¬Ω cup apple cider vinegar ¬Ω cup chicken broth ¬º cup light brown sugar 1 tablespoon prepared yellow mustard 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce 1 tablespoon chili powder 1 extra large onion, chopped 2 large cloves garlic, crushed 1 ¬Ω teaspoons dried thyme 8 hamburger buns, split 2 tablespoons butter, or as needed Directions Gather the ingredients. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco¬† Pour vegetable oil into the bottom of a slow cooker. Place pork roast into the slow cooker; pour in barbeque sauce, vinegar, and chicken broth. Stir in brown sugar, yellow mustard, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, onion, garlic, and thyme. Cover and cook on Low for 10 to 12 hours or High for 5 to 6 hours until pork shreds easily with a fork. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco¬† Remove pork from the slow cooker, and shred the meat using two forks. Return shredded pork to the slow cooker, and stir to combine with juices. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco¬† Spread the inside of both halves of hamburger buns with butter. Toast buns, butter-side down, in a skillet over medium heat until golden brown. Spoon pulled pork into toasted buns. Grant Webster / Food Styling: Lauren McAnelly / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco¬† Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 7,014 home cooks made it! The only change I made was I mixed all the ingredients in a bowl separately then dumped it on the pork so everything was mixed together well. 06 of 244 Photo by¬† MintBoba1642 07/05/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite I purchased an 8.9 lb pork shoulder butt and doubled the recipe (and used the ingredients indicated.) But I had to reduced the liquids in the crockpot as it was all the way to the top of the pot. I read on the web that the liquids should only cover less half the pot. And I had to give room to the natural juices produced by the pork. I am glad I made the adjustment! I also cut the pork so it could squeeze into the 6-7lb crockpot. I saved the extra bbq mixture (warmed) for family to put on their sandwiches. I slow cooked the pork for 14 hours and probably could have been safe at 12 hours. It turned out delicious and was a family favorite on July 4th. You must toast the buns to get that authentic sandwich taste! To complement the meal, I had cole slaw, corn on the cob, mac n cheese, fresh fruit, apple pie a la mode.There were a lot of leftovers from lunch and so my family was very happy about that! Please note that I started to prep the ingredients on day 1 and poured the mixture on top of the pork in the pot at about 8:00 pm. It slow cooked until 10:00 am on day 2 (next time I would stop cooking at 9:00 am). I took the pork out and let it sit for 30 minutes before pulling the pork. It was so tender and well seasoned. I think for 8 adults and 4 grandkids I would think a 6 lb pork shoulder butt should be sufficient if you don't want leftovers. 07 of 244 Photo by¬† FlimsyUdon4103 04/10/2024 A keeper!
